Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business”
Reviews.Author: treacleMerseyside
Reviews.Content: My partner was here on business for a week and I flew out to spend the weekend with him. Whilst there is nothing around and nothing to do in the immediate vicinity, the hotel itself is lovely. It's modern with good facilities albeit we were frustrated that the was was shut at 10.30pm on the Saturday night! There's a great little bar about 5 mins walk called Ranquilla 17 - turn right outside the hotel and then left over the bridge towards the metro station. Metro into the centre of Madrid (sol) took about 20 mins - it's all air conditioned, very quiet and a pleasant ride - unlike the London tube! I'd recommend the hotel but if you're going to see the sights and stay here then be prepared for a few metro journeys.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: herts66
Reviews.Content: Good business hotel as other reviews state Clean and modern rooms, freindly and efficent staff. Close to airport and business area. Free internet in lounge areas Breakfast and restaurant good quality and selection

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have business nearby....”
Reviews.Author: Nic0_K2
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel if you have a business purpose and can walk to your work. It is located in a residential / office neighborhood. There is nothing to do anywhere close to this hotel. If you are looking for some nightlife / weekend fun while traveling, move on down the metro a few stops to Goya and stay in that area. It is a 10-12 minute walk to the San Lorenzo metro stop, so be prepared for a hike each time you want to leave unless travelling by taxi. The staff here is wonderful. Keep in mind, this is Madrid not Paris or Berlin, so the English is not spoken extremely well. Some basic Spanish will go a long way and will be appreciated. The mini-bar is free. It is limited in terms of its stock. Coca-Cola, Diet Coke, Sprite, Fanta, and water plus 1 regular beer and 1 non-alcoholic beer per day. However, it is quite large so one can stock the fridge with other things like leftovers or beer from the grocery store. The gym is small, a treadmill, a bike, a few free weights and a bow-flex universal lifting machine. However, there is a TV, a stereo system and unlimited free individual bottled water, so its not too bad. Wish they had a pool. The room is nice and modern with a comfortable bed. Typical European hotel room, it is small. Breakfast is great. They have a buffet, but they also have a "made-to-order" menu with "huevos fritos" (fried eggs) and various cooked meats. Fresh squeezed orange juice and wonderful breads from the buffet make this a great breakfast. The only major negative is the wifi. It is free in the lobby but requires payment in your room. Sometimes the lobby connection if made in the lobby will continue to work in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Urban benefits with great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: DRoi
Reviews.Content: After traveling for a while thru Asia coming here at my first business stay in Madrid it seems to fit perfectly, when your office is in the neighborhood or on 15 min away by MRT it's a must stay. The hotel is nice, great looks and perfect breakfast serving good cheese,tomato, and anything else to start your morning good, you will have free wifi access and I heard that the mini bar was free. the rooms are modern so is the whole hotel actually. For me a must return on my next business trip as the staff is also very helpfull. If your with family and coming for the museums etc, try to find something in the city center, though price quality could be more off the travel times will make up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and people were friendly. however, The location is not inspiring at all. It is very far from the centre. The breakfast is very expensive. There was a fitness area which is nice but it was very small and without any window. Overall ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst location ever”
Reviews.Author: Valetejada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived the AC feria, and were very kindly greeted. Check in was fast and they offered to give us a room with special access beacuse my husband was on crutches. The room itself was small but very clean. The bathroom proved to be a little uncomfortable as the water from the shower splashed everywhere. The bed was very comfortable and sleeping there was nice. The big turndown is the location. It is close to nowhere and the closest subway station is 15 minutes walking and if you want to go somewhere it is at least half an hour away. Taxis are very expensive. One nice plus is the free mini bar which even has beer.

Reviews.Title: “great and beautiful design hotel”
Reviews.Author: mnielsen1974
Reviews.Content: great hotel, with a free minibar! and great design, please go there, only problem is the location...

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good service, convenient for barajas”
Reviews.Author: wineguru_12
Reviews.Content: I love this chain of hotels, maybe it isnt quite what it was before it was bought by Marriott, but still good. Excellent value for money, I just love the modern styling, not pretentious, just elegant. The free minibar is always a big plus and the amenities are excellent. Service was calm and polite, even when I checked out at 5am I got a smile. I would like to see a bigger tv with some more choice of channels however..

Reviews.Title: “For business only!”
Reviews.Author: Eleni_gak
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel quite frequently, for business. It is a modern hotel, with comfortable rooms and nice finishes. The room service is quite good, both value and price-wise. One of the great room features is that is has a free minibar. The rooms are generally clean. The staff is polite and willing to help. Access to the fitness room is free. The breakfast options are sufficient. The downside of the hotel is its location. If you are visiting Madrid for tourism and sightseeing, this hotel is not an option since it is located far from the city centre. It is however close to the Barajas airport.

Reviews.Title: “Made for purpose”
Reviews.Author: R_K_Rana
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel, close to the airport. Can be accessed by Metro or by taxi as well. Hotel is chic, modern and clean. By European standards, service is good. Internet is free in the lobby but chargeable in the room. Average choice for breakfast and lunch available. Since our meetings were in the vicinity so it worked fine for us. Mini bar is free and it has couple of beers, water still and sparkling, soft drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and great rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunnybombay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is value for money. Clean rooms and great service on check in and check out . Staff very courtesious not like europe. Very near to the fair grounds and great spanish food near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel next to Madrid's exhibition halls”
Reviews.Author: avaotto
Reviews.Content: Good facilities, modern and spacious room. Good breakfast with large selection of products and dishes. Located close to Madrid's exhibition halls, though not within walking distance. Also conveniently located for Barajas Airport. Good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerhshy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 separate nights over a period of two weeks in this hotel. It was in a great location for our business, but there's not much around the hotel as far as restaurants or shopping. The rooms were clean, if a bit on the small side for two people. There is a big lounge/work area where the WiFi is fast. A small bar area is located right outside the restaurant. They had a nice breakfast buffet. Because of our schedule, we were coming and going, and the staff was always very helpful with storing our luggage and getting us taxis, etc. We did use the metro a few times -- it's about an 8 minute walk. Close to the metro was a restaurant that served asturian food -- called Mater Asturiano. Good favaba and sidra.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business in the Area”
Reviews.Author: jnikjnik
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, well appointed room and bathroom. Good food at the restaurant - have tried their dinner, breakfast and business lunch. Not for tourists wanting to explore the city, but is great if you're visiting a company in the area. Have only stayed one night, so can't comment on the room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, pleasant atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: ralucapopescu
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights when I went to Madrid on a business trip. The rooms and the bathrooms are very nice and a modern style decorated. I liked very much the lobby and the bar area which were extremly friendly and the atmosphere there was very nice every evening. Easy to reach, close to the airport and the Madrid Feria.

Reviews.Title: “good design, but service and cleaniness could be better”
Reviews.Author: syabdafuer
Reviews.Content: The first impression was great - in the Lobby and the room as well. Very modern and a very stylish bathroom. Rooms are quite small as well as the TV. Minibar is free - beside 1 bottle of beer it contains different water obottles and 2 sodas. Refill every day. Free internet was advertised, but this is only available in the lobby with bad performance. Room service/cleaning is bad. The used shower and Toilet was not cleaned once during the 3 day stay. The very close by highway nois could be covered by keeping the window closed - with open window no chance to sleep. Breakfast was 24€ extra which I refused.

Reviews.Title: “A nice clean hotel. A little far from the metro stop.”
Reviews.Author: mooresf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the AC Feria for two nights. We wanted a hotel that was close to the airport. The metro ride is 15-20 minutes, plus a 10 minute walk through a quiet neighborhood. We did not find any restaurants/bars/shops walking distance from the hotel. The room was clean and modern but a little small. The bathroom walls are extremely thin. The price was great considering we stayed 2 weekend nights as the hotel caters to mostly business visitors. It is right off a freeway so I am sure it is convenient for those with cars. Not a great location for tourists visiting Madrid. It was perfect for us since we needed a quiet place near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, delicious food and great service”
Reviews.Author: beautyteknorth
Reviews.Content: As a business traveller I have tasted food in over 150 hotels. I can honestly say that the food in this hotel is among the best in its star rating. The dinner was presented beautifully and was very reasonably priced for the quality. The house red was a lovely Rioja, much better than many house wines I have had. Service at dinner was attentive and considerate. Breakfast was a little lacking in that it was very limited choice, even for a continental buffet, and I couldn't find any milk for my tea ... but maybe that's an English thing. The room was very comfortable and quiet, even though it was an outside room near the road. The shower was great and the decor was very stylish whilst still performing its function. My only gripe is that there wasn't an iron or ironing board in the room ... poor show from a business hotel. The hotel is definitely out of the way for leisure visitors to Madrid but for the money was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but not be called feira”
Reviews.Author: caputsilicis
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel and good service. but not exactly close at FEIRA DE MADRID!!!! near SanLorenzo metro station

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, but not much more”
Reviews.Author: Marc_Karin
Reviews.Content: THis is a good business hotel, but don't expect too much more. Situatoin is ideal for business, but it is i nthe middle of an admin/office area which is deserted at night. Food at the resto is ok, but there is no real bar. CLean and modern business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: JaimeEspadas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel AC Madrid Feria, although located some way out from the city centre, was just what we were looking for: a luxury, stylish venue with friendly staff who were always on hand to help, allowing us to relax and enjoy our romantic break. The special weekend offer which AC Hotels were offering gave us even more value for money and we came away feeeling extremely satisfied with a fautless weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice design but service is a bit indifferent”
Reviews.Author: mrintdsgn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully designed, but theservice at the front desk is quite indifferent. The restaurantis closed on Sundays, but they do offer a limited bar/room service menu. The hotel is in the mddle of nowhere and they do not offer an airport shuttle, which seems strange in that it is so close and seems that it's guests are most likely to be layover folks or businessmen wth eetings at all of the surrounding office buildings. Rooms are small but nicely done and wel appointed. Wold recommend the Hilton Madrid Airportover this place. Also beautifully designed, free airpor shuttle, more dining options and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in business park, next to M40, in airport vicinity.”
Reviews.Author: silvergate
Reviews.Content: Not wanting to drive into downtown Madrid and having an early flight out we chose this hotel as a base for exploring Madrid, leaving our car in the hotel garage.. The hotel caters primarily to businessmen, and in typical A/C Hotel chain fashion is super modern styled with shades of dark gray and black prevailing down to the head to toe black clad staff. An airport shuttle bus is available. Check-in was handled by a friendly Penelope Cruz look-alike. Although right next to the M40 motorway, our 6th floor room facing an adjacent office building was super quiet. comfortably furnished with a queen size bed, laminate flooring, safe, fridge with complementary refreshments, TV with international channels, a desk, and a super modern bathroom with soft towels and a glass-topped vanity with molded glass sink. Temperature control in the room was a definite problem, despite reporting it to the front desk and at one night have a maintenance staffer shake his head until we sent him away at 1 a.m., remained unresolved during our three night stay. An unexplained heat source behind the bathroom mirror made the mirror too hot to touch and heated the bath room all night. At the same time the room A/C system did not respond to the wall mounted thermostat. It went on to lower the room temperature to that of a fridge. The only option was on or off. Breakfast was buffet style with sufficient selections for everyone's taste. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant, but enjoyed very good Italian cooking in a reasonably priced neighborhood restaurant: A'Fenestella 100 yards from the Mar de Crystal square and subway station, or a short taxi ride from the hotel. Walking to the San Lorenzo subway station was an 8-10 minute affair, and from there downtown Madrid was reached in 20 minutes for one Euro with one change of subway lines along the route, not exactly the ideal but definitely an option for someone to visit Madrid' s downtown sights, all of which are near a subway exit. As for us, given the problems with A/C control of room temperatures, we would choose another hotel if we are again in the area.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place if you have business in NE Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bgunnarb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in an industrial area in NE Madrid, close to the motorway #40 and within walking distance from the Metro. Modern style, comfortable rooms, a small but well equiped gym in the basement, a restaurant that is OK makes it the perfect place to stay if you have business in the area. Across the motorway is a suburban area with shopping center, bars and a few restaurants. There is a public golf course nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: eye7eye
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, basic breakfast, good lunch, free mini-bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great inside - Lost in the middle of nowhere outside”
Reviews.Author: El_Fred
Reviews.Content: Overall I really liked it & enjoyed my stay. Strong points: - Modern design - High standing for Spain (comparable with UK 4 stars) - wide rooms with wide bathrooms - Small flat screen in room with 21 channels (although picture quality average) - Free WIFI on groundfloor Weakness: - Far from the subway (better to have a map) - In an offices area, nothing to see out there - Next to a highway (noise) Concretly: excellent if you are on a business trip in the area or if you want to stay in bed all weekend with your girlfriend. To avoid in you want to do sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for business trips although a bit far from main city”
Reviews.Author: Jagdish U
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern rooms with excellent decor. Its perfect for a business stay although its far from main city. The place is perfect if your work is in and around Campos de la Naciones or Mar de Cristal. Food is a definite drawback since th emenu is nothing to brag about. The best is the minibar is on the house and the staff is very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, business hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdeenen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 20 minutes (18 euro cabride) outside of the city center. We stayed here for a business trip. The rooms are very clean, friendly staff (which speaks english as well which is not common to find). Overall very good experience. I also really liked the decor. It was modern, easy to reach light switches. The free mini bar was also not bad (and it's stocked with tons of drinks). Easy to get in and out of the hotel. i.e. no extra stairs to carry suitcases over etc. Minuses: high-speed internet had to be paid for seperate. AC was a bit harder to work (not the typical 1 knob AC control).

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Madrid Feria by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: Via de los Poblados 3, 28033 Madrid, Spain
